availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lewis S. Jameson (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Susan H. McCarty. Father of Adelade Jameson, Mary Jameson, Henry Jameson, and Julia Jameson. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 143B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 9.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 8.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 4.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Mortality Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 577.
Find A Grave, "Lewis S. Jameson (1805-1869)," Memorial #132427863, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/132427863 (accessed March 16, 2020).
